My review for this place is long overdue.  Since I discovered it about a month ago, I've become a regular customer.  This cozy restaurant & bar has a fantastic selection of tapas, salads, and toasts (flatbread pizzas).  They also have a small but tasty selection of wines, and put lots of care into their mixed drinks as well.  The enormous gin & tonics are served with a dash of fresh ginger and has juniper berries floating among the ice.The menu is not your classic list of tapas, as the kitchen is very tiny so they only have an oven.  No deep fryer means no patatas bravas, but there's no shortage of tasty treats.  My favorite is the stuffed peppers with goat cheese and jam, the pan con tomate with extra spices, and of course you can't go wrong with the jamón iberico.Remember this place is small, so be prepared to wait for a table if you're going during peak meal times.  They only have one table that seats more than 4 people, so call ahead to make reservations for a group.
